docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, April 21 -- Chiefs of eleven navies maintained by Latin-American republics will soon visit the United States as guests of Admiral Harold R. Stark, Chief of Naval Operations.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, April 21 -- Chiefs of eleven navies maintained by Latin-American republics will soon visit the United States as guests of Admiral Harold R. Stark, Chief of Naval Operations.

headline.main: U.S. NAVY TO BE HOST TO 11 LATIN CHIEFS; Each Commander Will Bring an Aide for Defense Inspection

byline.original: Special to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: DRAGON-SLAYER: The patron of England, Aragon and Portugal is St. George. History records that he suffered martyrdom at Lydda in Palestine in 300 A.D., but little else is known about him. Since the sixth century he has been identified as a...
docs.lead_paragraph: DRAGON-SLAYER: The patron of England, Aragon and Portugal is St. George. History records that he suffered martyrdom at Lydda in Palestine in 300 A.D., but little else is known about him. Since the sixth century he has been identified as a dragon-slayer. Since the fourteenth century Englishmen have annually celebrated his feast day on April 23.

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, April 26 -- The way was paved today for the twenty-one American republics through a unified policy to take over more than 160 idle foreign ships in ports of the Western Hemisphere when the Inter-American Economic Advisory Committee...
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, April 26 -- The way was paved today for the twenty-one American republics through a unified policy to take over more than 160 idle foreign ships in ports of the Western Hemisphere when the Inter-American Economic Advisory Committee adopted unanimously a resolution recognizing the right of each of them to take over the vessels.

headline.main: AMERICAS FOR UNITY ON SEIZURE OF SHIPS; Advisory Council of Republics Unanimously Adopts Policy on Idle Foreign Vessels SHIP SEIZURE POLICY SET FOR AMERICAS

byline.original: Special to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: ANOTHER very active week in the local art world has served to bring into prominence several group events and interesting one-man shows. These now supplement others that continue, or replace exhibitions that have run their course and departed.

docs.snippet: BUENOS AIRES, Argentina, April 26 (AP) -- Private dispatches from Paraguay today describe that censor-bound nation as on "the verge of a political upheaval" with events moving rapidly to a showdown between Provisional President Higinio Morinigo and...
docs.lead_paragraph: BUENOS AIRES, Argentina, April 26 (AP) -- Private dispatches from Paraguay today describe that censor-bound nation as on "the verge of a political upheaval" with events moving rapidly to a showdown between Provisional President Higinio Morinigo and the exiled former President, Colonel Rafael Franco.
docs.abstract: Rutledge, Arch; Home on the River

headline.main: PARAGUAYAN REVOLT IS SAID TO BE NEAR; Franco Forces Are Expected to Try to Oust President Morinigo

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, April 26 -- In Latin America a closely integrated airline network is under more or less direct control of the German and Italian Governments. About 20,000 miles of scheduled airlines comprise this network, although 1,200 miles are due to...
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, April 26 -- In Latin America a closely integrated airline network is under more or less direct control of the German and Italian Governments. About 20,000 miles of scheduled airlines comprise this network, although 1,200 miles are due to be lopped off in the next few weeks as a result of the Peruvian Government's closing Lufthansa Peru and seizing its planes.
docs.abstract: comment on German, Ital and U S airline activities in South Amer; map

headline.main: AXIS KEEPS UP ITS AIRLINES IN THE SOUTHERN REPUBLICS; Latin-American Service Far-Flung Today in Spite of the War and Competition

docs.snippet: The foreign exchange market showed a firm undertone last week, buttressed as this was by the economic and monetary agreements which this country has arranged with Canada and China and which expands by several the number of alien currencies now within...
docs.lead_paragraph: The foreign exchange market showed a firm undertone last week, buttressed as this was by the economic and monetary agreements which this country has arranged with Canada and China and which expands by several the number of alien currencies now within the orbit of official support.

headline.main: FOREIGN EXCHANGE RATES; WEEK ENDED APRIL 26, 1941
